description: Shadow Lady uses a last-ditch attack to defeat the escaped demon, but at the cost of being turned into stone herself. The demon kills the kidnapper and gives Shadow Lady another chance to defeat him. To further complicate things, Bright, using Lime's transmitter, comes onto the scene and thinks Shadow Lady was the one who killed the man...
name: The Awakening - Part 6

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
With most of the squad dead or in pieces, the remainder of the Sentinel Squad must find out what they are made of to escape the Savage Land! The action-packed origin of the new Sentinels rockets towards its conclusion!

Despite the catastrophic casualties, Alexander Lexington's resourceful squad was able to thwart a Mutate plan to build an army of genetically enhanced dinosaurs, as well as rescue a pair of imprisoned teammates in the process.

The team was able to stop the threat. First, by infiltrating the Mutate compound, then pooling their various specialties to create an ultra-modified super-Sentinel from the scrap metal of their fallen comrades. Now, the Sentinel Squad survivors are looking forward to a well-deserved bit of rest and recuperation. Unfortunately, theu're about to get a nasty surprise, courtesy of their treacherous turncoat teammate, Nathaniel Briggs...
name: Tin Can Heroes, Part 4: A Prehistory Of Violence

description: What now?! Bright is convinced that Shadow Lady has murdered Klein, and there's no way Aimi can possibly explain the secret of the Demon Stones--that would mean certain death for De-mo at the hands of the Demon World Police! But even if Aimi could find a way to convince Bright that Shadow Lady is innocent, there's no time for that now: the fate of the whole world depends on her finding and sealing up the Demon Stones!
name: The Awakening - Part 7

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: The Sentinel Squad's trial by fire has finally reached its end! Now it's time for their permanent assignment...the X-Men. Find out the final piece of the puzzle in this final issue to Sentinel Squad O*N*E! Â
name: Tin Can Heroes, Part 5: Creep Mission

description: Gray City's corrupt Mayor Karman has become a demon! One by one, Shadow Lady is recovering the demon stones and vanquishing the evildoers corrupted by their demon power. But she's not getting any thanks for it! In fact, the people of Gray City think she's gone totally mad and is murdering their favorite citizens! As the tide of public opinion turns against Shadow Lady, Aimi herself learns that even Bright has lost his faith in Shadow Lady's goodness. It's time for the big question, Bright: do you really love Shadow Lady? And how do you love her?
name: Sudden Death - Part 1

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Demo's Demon Stone detector has led Aimi to the Gray City Cathedral, where the bishop himself has been corrupted by the evil power of the stones. But what should have been an easy mission goes terribly wrong, when Shadow Lady finds herself face to face with Detective Bright!
name: Sudden Death - Part 2

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Trapped in Bright's shower, Aimi is helpless as the pounding water washes off her magic eye shadow! If Bright sees her true form, her secret is out -- and the Demon World Police will kill her! But the arch-demon Zera has been resurrected from the last Demon Stone, and the Demon World Police must ask Shadow Lady to pull off the greatest heist of her spectacular career!
name: Sudden Death - Part 3

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Shadow Lady goes toe-to-toe with the arch-demon of destruction! With her final remaining smidgen of magic eye shadow, Aimi must transform into Shadow Lady for perhaps the last time to defend the future of the human race. It doesn't help that the citizens of Gray City all think that she's the demon's master -- and they're all calling for her head! She has only minutes left before the other Arch-Demons awaken -- which will cause all of mankind and demonkind to perish from the face of the Earth!
name: Sudden Death - Part 4

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Final Issue, and Chapter.
name: Sudden Death - Part 5

person_credits.name: Masakazu Katsura
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
The time for Yuki's parent-teacher conference has finally arrived, and Yuki must learn how to make his own decisions. Also, Tohru sets off on a quest to find out it Kureno Sohma is the same person Arisa has been in love with all this time. Along the way she will discover the tragic relation of Momo and Momiji.

Chapter 72 - 77.
name: Vol. 13

description: Isuzu loves snooping through Shigure's life. She is totally convinced that he is hiding something. Tohru finds an ill and passed out Isuzu in the house! Tohru tries to drag Isuzu to the hospital. Meanwhile, Yuki goes to the ASB council room only to find it trashed again! But as the secrets of who trashed the room come out of the closet, Yuki accidentally gets locked in one. Who will be the one to help him get out?
name: Vol. 14

description:
Yuki's past finally is revealed! But is it all too much to bear? His sickness takes a turn for the worse, and after Akito reminds Yuki how loathed he is, his will to live might finally be drained... Meanwhile, as Tohru is getting ready to perform in Cinderella, the class decides that they have to rewrite the play. But no amount of revision will prevent Tohru from improvising her loving feelings for a certain someone. Just who is the mystery man?

Chapter 84 - 89.
name: Vol. 15

description: Tragedy continues to smother the Sohma family. It seems to be spreading to those connected to the Sohmas. Kyo has met Tohru's mother in the past. His memory involves Tohruâs birth. Is she ready to hear the truth about her mother and father. Meanwhile, Yuki declares his independence from the actions of others. Akito about his own actions. How will Akito handle Yukiâs declaration?
name: Vol. 16

description: Akito has more than skeletons hiding in the closet. The curse is not the only reason Kureno won't leave Akito. Who can make Arisa understand Kureno's devotion to Akito? Kureno must talk with Shigure if he ever wants to be free from Akito. Meanwhile, the dark shadow that hovers over the Sohma Estate has fallen on Tohru. Is there any cure for this curse?
name: Vol. 17

description: As rumors swirl about Machi trying to kill her little brother, Kakeru figures that the only person who can get the truth out of her is Yuki. But when the two of them visit her, they learn a shocking secret. Later, Motoko wants to tell Yuki her feelings before she graduates and leaves the school--and him--forever. But will their parting be such sweet sorrow?
name: Vol. 18

description: As the Fruits Basket saga continues, the relationship between Tohru and Kyo becomes increasingly complicated, especially since most of the members of the Zodiac seem to look down on him. Tohru comes to the realization that if she wants to save Kyo, she'll have to create some sort of trigger to break his curse. But what, if anything, can cure Kyo?
name: Vol. 19

description: Kagura and Kazuma hotly discuss Tohru liking Kyo. With Kagura's forceful encouragement, will Tohru be able to muster up the courage to tell Kyo how she feels? Meanwhile, Ren is determined to get her hands on Akito's mystery box--even if it means killing for it!
name: Vol. 20

description:
Aric has severed the consciousness of Paul Bouvier from the X-O armor and, for the very first time, made it entirely his own. But, when Paul takes control of the shattered remnants of Shanhara, Aric's original armor, he'll have to face his enemy in his new form as Alloy!

Paul, now Alloy, continues his attack on Aric.
name: Transformations - Part 2

description:
Murdered by his sadistic parents, Obadiah Archer returns from the dead with uncanny physical abilities and a mission: to punish all evil-doers like his parents. Learning martial arts in the Orient, Archer soon becomes the world's greatest fighter! He soon encounters Armstrong, a free-spirited immortal with the strength of ten men! They have just met when they are attacked by Armstrong's foes, the Sect. Can they survive their crazy friendship?

1.: Regular Cover

2.: Gold Logo Cover

1st appearances:

- Archer

- Armstrong

- Mahmud
name: Lifelines Part 1: Revival

description: Kyo finishes telling Tohru about his role in her mother's death and how the reason he disappeared for so long was because he felt so guilty about it. He explains that he overcame his guilt by blaming everything on Yuki, but he now realizes that he was only running away from his own feelings. But how will he feel when Tohru says that she still loves him anyway?
name: Vol. 21

description:
Prelude to the Wolfbridge Affair! Someone is breaking the most dangerous inmates out of Toyo Harada's correctional facility for mentally unstable Harbingers and he needs Aric's help to stop them!

From Wizard magazine, a Gold variant cover also exists.

Released after X-O Manowar 34.
name: Chance Encounter

description: Dagon and the vampire hordes come together for one final battle. But things go from bad to worse when Deathwing and Judge & Jury enter the fray.
name: The Darkening Night, Part Four: Sometimes a Mirage is Real!

description:
In the aftermath of their bloody battle with the vampires, the Team skips out on Nightwing's wedding to Starfire and attempts to get their heads right.

The Titans meet up with old friends...some who aren't so friendly now.
name: Hunter

description: Battalion confronts his wife. Meanwhile, the Team Titans and Metallik confront the metal monster from the future.
name: The Dead Future

description: Mirage attempts to deal with the betrayal of her lover from the future--and the nightmare he has become: Deathwing!
name: Times Are Far Between (And Few At That)

description:
The Team Titans encounter the diabolical quartet of Clock King, Time Commander, Calendar Man, and Chronos!

A simple trip to the mall becomes complicated when a team of villains becomes interested in the wares of an old friend of Battallion.
name: When Titans Clash -- A Lot

description: In the aftermath of their battle with Clock King, Time Commander, Calendar Man, and Chronos, the Team Titans are treated as heroes by the media.
name: The Hardest Copy or Truth and Consequences

description:
When an incendiary conflict flares on an disputed border between Russia and Brasnya, Optimus Prime leads an Autobot assault team into the area in an effort to frustrate Megatron's efforts to agitate the situation and capture the facsimile Georgi Koska.
In the meantime, on American soil, Verity Carlo, Jimmy Pink, Ironhide and Ratchet are ater the real responsibles of the abduction of Sunstreaker and Hunter O'Nion.
name: Issue 4

description: In this tale of unrest, the members of the Team Titans must all deal with their own personal nightmares.
name: To Sleep, Perchance to Dream...

description:
1. Cover by George Perez.
  2. Written by Lou Mougin and Mark Waid.
  3. Consultant by George Olshevsky.
  4. Typography and production by Tony Frutti.
  5. Reviewed by Chuck Huber, Andrew McLaney, Andy Mangles and Mike Tiefenbacher.
  6. Special thanks to Robert Greenberger and George Perez.
  7. Approved by the Staff of DC Comics.
  • Inside Front Cover to Page 2: Introduction by Murray R. Ward.
  • Pages 3-32 and the Inside Back Cover: An index to the twelve issue mini-series: Crisis on Infinite Earths to include a photo of each cover, the creators, featured and supporting characters, comments and a synopsis.

Notes:

  • Errors and corrections in this issue were noted in The Official Crisis on Infinite Earths Crossover Index #1.
name: The Official Crisis on Infinite Earths Index

volume.name: The Official Crisis on Infinite Earths Index

description: Bloodshot visits the neighborhood he grew up in and is mistaken for infamous mob enforcer Bruno Mortalli, his own half-remembered father! When he learns that the F.B.I. is hot on his father's trail, Bloodshot joins in the hunt. When father and son reunite it won't be peaceful, and little remain the same after this final confrontation of Bloodshot and his past.
name: Last Stand

description: In Brasnya, Megatron is decided to finish the never-ending conflict between him and Optimus Prime. Once and for all and with the Ore-13 upgrade, he can backup his words. Meanwhile, Verity Carlo and Jimmy Pink have been ambushed by some traps of Machination while Ratchet and Ironhide are waiting for them, unaware that the whole place is ready to explode.
name: Issue 5

description:
Optimus Prime is dead. Or at least, that's what it seems. But if he's down, what chances are left for the Autobots agains the Mighty Megatron? Meanwhile, the time is expiring not only for Verity, Jimmy, Ironhide and Ratchet, but also for Hot Rod who is under heavy fire. He's in charge of the facsimile but Skywarp and Thundercraker won't let him flee that easily.
With the power balance between Autobots and Decepticons lost, the fragile peace on Earth is about to end. Finally, Devastation is upon us.
name: Issue 6

description: What started out as an exercise in keeping a personal comics journal, quickly evolved into Liz Prince's first solo graphic novel. Described as a mix between Jeffrey Brown and James Kochalka, Liz's comics are comprised of short vignettes that capture all the cute, gross, and endearing aspects of relationships. It's the perfect book for all those fans of autobiographical comics who want to see a happy ending.
name: Will You Still Love Me If I Wet The Bed?

volume.name: Will You Still Love Me If I Wet The Bed?

description: Tony Consiglio's Doublecross is one of the funniest and longest-running mini-comics in the biz. Whether you've been lucky enough to see it before or not, here's your chance to grab a cool collection of the best parts of the entire Doublecross saga. Telling a complete story, this hilarious excerpt has us heading to Queens, New York to get a glimpse of Tony's family life, odd jobs, and soon-to-be girlfriends - well, more or less.
name: More or Less

description: Top Shelf is proud to announce the signing of an all new, all-ages series of graphic novels, entitled Korgi. Christian Slade, a former Disney animator and currently full-time freelance illustrator, has brought to Top Shelf a gorgeously illustrated woodland fantasy about a young girl Ivy, her dog Sprout, and their amazing adventures in Korgi Hollow. Along with this big debut, Korgi will also appear in Top Shelf's May 5th Free Comic Book Day Book (Owly & Korgi) with an original story to help introduce everyone to the series. This amazing combination of adventure and fantasy will appeal to anyone who loves Andy Runton's Owly and Jeff Smith's Bone. Stock up for the launch of something very daring and very new!
name: Sprouting Wings

description: The Cosmic Collector is the second volume in the critically acclaimed, all-ages graphic novel series, Korgi. In this volume, things are not going too well in Korgi Hollow. While a mysterious hunter has trapped and clipped the wings off of many mollies, Ivy and Sprout search for answers in the surrounding woods - but they may be facing something that is totally out of this world! Korgi is a gorgeously illustrated woodland fantasy perfect for fans of J.R.R. Tolkien or Andy Runton.
name: The Cosmic Collector
Volume 1
All Flee!
Daydream Lullabies: A Billy Dogma Experience

volume.name: Daydream Lullabies: A Billy Dogma Experience

description: Deep in the forest, robots are gathering plant and animal samples, and bringing them back to Mother Computer's Knowledge Extractor for analysis. When one spunky monkey breaks free of the device, a short circuit burns out the power Crystal in one of Mother's Cognitive Reactors.
name: Monkey Vs. Robot and the Crystal of Power

person_credits.name: James Kochalka
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, cover, production

volume.name: Monkey vs. Robot and the Crystal of Power

name: The Octopi and the Ocean

description: Andy Wicks is a forty-something father of two who's tried everything to quit smoking - from going cold turkey, to the latest patches and nicotine chewing gums - so he decides he'll give this hypnosis thing a try. What's the worst that could happen? Unfortunately, Andy gets dealt a fate worse than death - high school! Transported back to 1985, Andy returns to his formative years as a gangly, awkward teenager. Is he doomed to relive the mistakes of his past, or has he been given a second chance to get things right? One thing's for sure, this time he's going to ask out that girl from math class!
name: HC
Topolino, Minni e il tesoro della corona (p.1)

description:
After the events of Escalation, Optimus is troubled by the visions of Nova Prime and his dangerous intentions. He seeks counsel of the only Autobot he trusts enough, Omega Supreme, in order to know the true nature and story of one ancient bearer of the Matrix. But things won't be easy for Optimus as a faction of Decepticons are targeting him for extinction. The effects of a hidden truth, may change the Prime lineage forever.

BONUS

  • A 7 page preview of Devastation.

The Man With The Molten Touch; a living stalagmite named Stalagron attacks Superman with a Kryptonite meteor while Batman fights off a bunch of bats.

  1. Cover by Ed Hannigan and Klaus Janson.
  2. "The Man with the Molten Touch" written by Doug Moench, penciled by Adrian Gonzales, inked by Tony DeZuniga, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Ben Oda.

Notes:

  • 1st appearance of Stalogron, the next issue gives his origin.
name: The Man With the Molten Touch

description:
The cover is a reprint of Limited Collectors' Edition #C-41 by Alex Toth

1. Table of Contents

2. [story reprinted from Collectors' Edition #C-41] (with Robin, Marvin, Wendy, Wonder Dog, Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern (Hal Jordan), Aquaman, Flash, Atom, Hawkman, Red Tornado, Elongated Man, Green Arrow, Black Canary, Starro, Amazo / written by E. Nelson Bridwell)

3. Cover reprint of Super Friends #1 (by Ernie Chan and Vince Colletta)

4. The Fury of the Super Foes (Superfriends and Marvin, Wendy, Wonderdog vs Superfoes (Penguin, Toyman, Poison Ivy, Cheetah Human Flying Fish / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 1 )

5. Cover reprint of Super Friends #6 (by Ramona Fradon and Bob Smith)

6. The Menace of the Menagerie Man! (Superfriends with Marvin, Wendy, and Wonder Dog, Atom, Commissioner Gordon vs Menagerie Man / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 6 )

7. Cover reprint of Super Friends #7 (by Ramona Fradon and Bob Smith)

8. The Warning of the Wondertwins (Wonder Twins, Gleek, Marvin, Wendy, Wonder Dog, Super Friends, Justice League of America (Flash, Green Lantern, Green Arrow, Hawkman, Hawkgirl, Elongated Man), Global Guardians (Seraph, Godiva, Impala, Owlwoman, Grax as villain / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 7 )

9. Cover reprint of Super Friends #8 (by Ramona Fradon and Bob Smith)

10. The Mind Killers! (Superfriends, Wonder Twins, Gleek, Marvin, Wendy, Wonder Dog, Global Guardians (Jack O'Lantern, Tuatara, Thunderlord, Bushmaster, Rising Sun, Atom, Grax (villain) / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 8 )

11. Cover reprint of Super Friends #9 (by Ramona Fradon and Vince Colletta)

12. Three Ways to Kill a World (Superfriends, Wonder Twins, Marvin and Wendy, Justice League of America, Global Guardians (Olympian, Little Mermaid, Tasmanian Devil, Icemaiden), Grax (villain) / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 9 )

13. Cover reprint of Super Friends #14 (by Ramona Fradon and Bob Smith)

14. Elementary! (Super Friends, Wonder Twins / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 14 )

15. The Origin of the Wondertwins (Wonder Twins, Super Friends / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 14 )

16. Cover reprint of Super Friends #21 (by Ramona Fradon and Bob Smith)

17. Battle Against the Superfriends! (Super Friends, Wonder Twins / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends # 21)

18. Cover reprint of Super Friends #27 (by Ramona Fradon and Bob Smith)

19. The Spaceman Who Stole Atlantis! (Super Friends, Wonder Twins, Aqualad, Mera / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Super Friends #27

20. TV Cartoons (How a TV Cartoon is Created) / by Alex Toth : reprinted from Collectors' edition #C-41)
name: Your Favorite Television Super-Team Is Back!

description: Bitter enemies form an uneasy alliance. But can even the combined might of the Thundercats and the Mutants hope to defeat the full power of Mumm-Ra unleashed?! Â  Â
name: Mumm-Ra Times Three!

description: After a misunderstanding, things escalate out of hand and the Thundercats go to war with the Rockmen of Third Earth. Â Â
name: The Price Of Pride

description:
Cover: Simon Parr (Pye) (Stalag 666)

  • Judge Dredd - Firestorm (part 2) (Robbie Morrison - Sam Hart)
  • The Red Seas - Old Gods (part 6) (Ian Edginton - Steve Yeowell)
  • A.B.C. Warriors - The Volgan War - Book Three (part 5) (Pat Mills - Clint Langley)
  • Stalag 666 (part 6) (Tony Lee - Jon Davis-Hunt)
  • Lobster Random - The Forget-Me-Knot (part 5) (Simon Spurrier - Carl Critchlow)
name: Prog 1605

description: Who is this Pumm-Ra?
Regular edition, ashcan, special edition, 2nd print, and collector's edition covers.
name: Gods and Beasts

description: Gene Simmons' stranger in a strange land tale continues, as Denizen Xeng Ral, a solitary fugitive to Earth from his own world, the Nether Ether, finds strange allies in a good-hearted drug dealer and a hardened police detective. Lethal enemies abound, too, as the mysterious Celestial Defense Ministry joins Etherian Hunters in the desperate chase for the now-exposed Xeng Ral.

Celebrate 25 glorious years of rubber monsters and endless corridors with this affectionate tribute to Doctor Who by Tim Quinn and Dicky Howett. Regular contributors to the Doctor Who Magazine Quinn and Howett are happy to lauch this second volume of their alternative view of the world of Doctor who and the seven Doctors on you, the unsuspecting public. Bursting at the seams with jokes, cartoons and wacky features, it's definately bigger on the inside!

A collection of Tim Quinn and Dicky Howett's humorous strips based on TV show Doctor Who and its characters. The two cartoonists regularly contributed a three panel comic strip, Doctor Who?, which was printed in Doctor Who Magazine. This was the second volume of all-new material they had produced, following 1987's The Doctor Who Fun Book, which had been published by Target Books, the same company that (at this time) printed novelisations of the Doctor Who TV stories.

volume.name: Doctor Who: It's Bigger on the Inside!

description: International superstar Gene Simmons creates his own version of the classic 'stranger in a strange land' with his latest comic book, Zipper! After a daring escape from his other-dimensional home, the Nether Ether, denizen Xeng Ral finds himself on planet Earth-lost, alone, curious and confused. Protected only by a specially equipped exo-suit, Xeng Ral sets out to explore his new world, finding both allies and enemies, all the while desperately evading those who would hunt him down from the Nether Ether.

Gene Simmons' stranger in a strange land saga continues as Denizen Xeng Ral (known to his Earth friends as 'Zipper') finds himself dangerously pursued by nefarious forces from both planet Earth and his home world, Etheria. His only hope for escape and survival lies with his strange new allies-a two-bit criminal with a heart of gold and a jaded vice detective.

Gene Simmons' stranger in a strange land tale continues, as Denizen Xeng Ral and his rag tag group of allies continue their dangerous flight from the mysterious Celestial Defense Ministry and the Etherian Hunters, who are seeking to capture Xeng at all costs.

Gene Simmons' stranger-in-a-strange-land tale continues, as Denizen Xeng Ral and the Etherian Hunters face off in an epic fight to the finish through the streets of Detroit. Meanwhile, Foster Deveroux and his Cosmic Defense Ministry plot their own nefarious scheme against Xeng's only Earth friends.

Denizen Xeng Ral has defeated the Etherian Hunters only to face off against the Celestial Defense Ministry militia in a final bloody battle... the amazing first story arc of Gene Simmons' stranger-in-a-strange-land tale reaches its spectacular conclusion!

If you've been Jonesing for Indy, MAD #490 is just for you! Our newest issue cracks the whip at Dr. Jones, Iron Man, the Clintons, and Whole Foods! Plus spoofs of 30 Rock and Dexter, Spy Vs. Spy, What the Heck is the Difference?, Monroe, the Fold-In and much, much more!

Our newest issue is a mandate for four dollars and change â including special posters of both McCain and Obama! Elect to buy the latest issue and you'll also get our spoofs of Indiana Jones and the Kingdom the Crystal Skull andPrince Caspian! Plus outtakes from The Hills, our parody of Now That's What I Call Music! and our brand-new Amy Winehouse comic strip "Amy"! And let's not forget, Spy vs. Spy, What the Heck is the Difference?, the Fold-In, Planet Tad and much more! Remember MAD #493 â buy it early, and buy it often!

If you care at all about the environment, you'll buy our latest waste of paper! MAD's newest issue tears apart "The 50 Worst Things About the Internet," the war on terror, polygamy cult families, greasy fast food restaurants and idiotic cooking shows! We also goof on Staples with a 4-page parody of the store's catalog! Plus, we look at the creepy similarities between the Bush Family and Family Guy, mock Obama and slam Mixed Martial Arts! All this AND the Darker Side of the Lighter Side, Spy Vs. Spy, What the Heck is the Difference? the Fold-In and much more! So quit hugging that tree, hop into your hybrid and go buy it today!
name: Mad Goes Green

description: Kyo finally makes the decision to stop running from his fears and confront his birth father. But how will he react to his father's pressure to accept an unwanted truth? Meanwhile, the curse continues to loosen its hold on the members of the Zodiac, but as Akito's control over the Sohma family slips away, will the last vestiges of her sanity and reason slip away, too? With Kureno injured and Tohru in peril, Akito has come to a crossroads...
name: Vol. 22

description: The final volume! Curses have been broken and the eternal banquet has finally come to a close. But there are still some loose ends to be wrapped up before the last page of Fruits Basket arrives! How will the members of the Zodiac deal with their newfound freedom? Can forgiveness come in the wake of Akito's past actions, and a new surprising revelation?
name: Vol. 23

description: Kid Eternity is on it again!
Kid Eternity is determined to teach an enfuriating actress a lesson about behaving politely enough!

Has Tony Stark come face to face with his equal? His betterâ¦? Stark Industries is beset on all sides by the evil Ezekiel Stane and his hordes of suicide bombers around the world. Can Iron Man be in four places at once while his empire crumbles?

Is this the day the Man of Iron finally meets his match? The answer....maybe so. Tony sends his Iron Men to disable the bombers, he doesn't want a body count. But the bombers are still set in their mind their the martyrs and Stane is the man who will lead them. Tony improvises his fight with Stane bringing in more Iron Man armors to his fight in attempts to distract Stane long enough and give him an advantage. Soon Tony must take it into his own iron cold hands to defeat this man, but as he knew it would happen the bombers set off the bombs within their suits and three go off leveling cities.

His fight with Stane is a trying one will he make the killshot or will he not. Soon he makes the decision that affects the entire globe, the world without electricity. Trillions lost for one pathetic excuse for a child....Tony is angry and he makes the final showdown between his long time nemesis son a good one making Stane see what he has done. The world will not be the same, and Tony will never be the same again once he sees what he must do to stop this from ever happening again.
name: The Five Nightmares, Part 6: Irrational Actors

description:
When he was little, high school student and amateur mechanic Shirou Emiya was adopted by a magus man. Now he wants nothing more than to follow in his stepfather's footsteps and become a hero of justice. Little does he know that a war is waging among some chosen magi, and that he is about to become its focal point...

Story and art by Dat Nishiwaki and Original Concept by Type-moon.
name: Volume 1

description: Publisher: Charlton Comics
name: Love Diary

description: Collects the first full year of Kochalka's diary, drawn in comic strip form in his sketchbook. Drawn with relaxed and beautiful brushwork, these strips perfectly capture the rhythm of daily life. From the hilarious to the sad, from the poetic to the drunken, these strips offer a direct and intimate portrait of the life of one of America's most important alternative cartoonists.
name: Volume 1

description: Following the incredible success of his first diary sketchbook, Top Shelf is proud to announce year two of James Kochalka's Sketchbook Diary. Since October 1998, James Kochalka has kept a daily diary, drawn in comic strip form in his sketchbook. Drawn with relaxed and beautiful brushwork, these charming and addictive strips perfectly capture the rhythm of daily life. From the hilarious to the sad, from the poetic to the drunken, these strips offer a direct and intimate portrait of the life of one of America's most important alternative cartoonists. This ambitious volume collects the second full year of Kochalka's diary, including his infamous rock tour of Scandinavia.
name: Volume 2

description: The Sketchbook Diaries are Kochalka's masterwork. Sometimes sweet, sometimes twisted, always honest and often hilarious, they've garnered James two Ignatz awards and as well as a Harvey nomination for "Best Cartoonist." In this fourth volume, James grows a beard, gets his wife pregnant, plays a bunch of rock shows, plays a bunch of video games, struggles with the meaning of life, and draws a bunch of the best comics of his career.
name: Volume Four

description: From the silly to the sad, from the mundane to the fantastic, James Kochalka's diary comic strips cover the human experience. See his life reproduced in simple four-panel comic strips. A remarkably complex and nuanced portrait of a human being!
name: Volume Three
Stories of Chilling Horror by the King of Fantasy

description: The first in a series of prestigious adaptations of the classic Universal Monster films, Frankenstein is a squarebound, fully-painted, 48-page one-shot, faithfully adapting the groundbreaking film. Taken directly from the screenplay, this is destined to be a film buff's dream come true, as Denis Beauvais brings every stitch of Boris Karloff's unforgettable presence to the comics page as the monster of all monsters!
name: Frankenstein

description: The horrific story of an obsession that would not die. Faithfully adapted from the Universal Studios film, this is the haunting story of Ardeth Bey and his love for the Princess Ankhsenamun -- an unholy love that reaches out from beyond death and into your nightmares!
name: The Mummy

description: Greetings, Universal Monster fans! It's the third in our series of prestigious adaptations of the classic Universal films of yesteryear, and this time the spotlight is on the Lord of the Undead -- Dracula! Lavishly painted by movie poster artist extraordinaire Jonathan D. Smith, this faithful adaptation brings the enigmatic Count of Transylvania to the comics page in loving detail in a collectible, high-quality package! More fun than a barrel of garlic!
name: Dracula

description:
When the Mummy Walks

A reprinted story from Tales to Astonish #31.

Where Will You Be, When...The Spider Strikes!

A reprinted story from Journey Into Mystery #73.

Behold Him! He Is the Martian!

A reprinted story from Tales to Astonish #25.
name: The Mummy's Secret
Fear for Sale

volume.name: Friendly Ghost Casper and the Good Little Witch Wendy: Ghosts and Witches

description: The Hobgoblin lives! Rising from the legacy of the Green Goblin, Spider-Man's most enduring foe, comes the deadly Hobgoblin! His true identity is one of the most complex mysteries Spidey has ever faced. Featuring the Black Cat, the Kingpin, Madame Web, Mary Jane, the Prowler and more! See Spider-Man's earliest battles with one of his deadliest foes! Collecting AMAZING SPIDER-MAN (1963) #238-239, #244-245 and #249-251; and PETER PARKER, THE SPECTACULAR SPIDER-MAN (1976) #43, #47-48 and #85.
name: The Origin of the Hobgoblin

volume.name: The Amazing Spider-Man: The Origin of the Hobgoblin

name: Vampirella Must Die: Part 1 of the Definitive Infinity Virus
